title: read-backup-repositories output
description: Look up Restic repositories inside all backup destinations and return a list of them.

module_ui_name.description: Original module label, assigned by the user.

node_fqdn.description: The FQDN of the node where the module of the backup is hosted.

path.description: Path of the repository, relative to the backup destination.

name.description: Name of the module. It is equal to the module image name.

uuid.description: Universal, unique identifier of the module instance.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of the last backup run.

repository_name.description: Human readable name of the backup destination.

repository_provider.description: Type of backup destination provider, e.g. SMB, S3...

repository_url.description: Restic URL of the backup destination.

installed_instance.description: If the backup belongs to an installed module instance this is its module ID.

installed_instance_ui_name.description: If the backup belongs to an installed module instance this is its module friendly name.

is_generated_locally.description: Tells if the backup originates from the local cluster or from another cluster. The null value is returned if this information is missing completely, as it happens in old backups.
